title: Inventors
text:
Jason Bowman
Engineering major at Harvey Mudd College (grad 25), with experience in embedded systems, electrical engineering, control systems, DSP, electromechanical systems, and mechanical design.



Mechanical design was my first engineering interest when entering Harvey Mudd College. Although I was ultimately drawn to the realm of electrical and embedded systems, mechanical design has always remained one of my top three interests in engineering. I love working with my hands, learning new things, and seeing a final product come together through the countless twists and turns of the design process.

Larry (Gengyan) Liu
Iâ€™m a senior Physics major at Pomona College with extensive experience in mechanical design, fluid dynamics research, and innovative engineering projects. From designing a tracked electric platform with two-speed transmission to simulating and experimenting vortex ring formation in Sphagnum moss, Iâ€™ve pursued my passion for creating sophisticated mechanical systems throughout my undergraduate career.



My journey in mechanical design began in my freshman year, driven by a deep fascination with designing and building functional mechanical systems. Though I wish I had formal mechanical design education earlier, the self-taught path has given me unique perspectives and problem-solving approaches. My work spans from non planar superconducting stellarator magnets to amphibious robots and shaped charge simulations, reflecting my diverse interests in applied physics and engineering.
Future Plans: Iâ€™m excited to continue my academic journey as a Kummer I&E Doctoral Fellow at Missouri S&T, where Iâ€™ll advance research in energetic materials safety and applications.

Iâ€™m a senior at Harvey Mudd College majoring in engineering, with a strong interest in mechanical design and hands-on fabrication.



I enjoy working in both the metal and wood shops, where I apply practical skills to bring ideas to life. Iâ€™m especially passionate about projects that combine technical precision with creative problem-solving.

title: About
text:
This is the final project for E177 Mechanical Design at Harvey Mudd College, taught by Professor Mendelson.

Professors & Instructors Acknowledgements

Itâ€™s no wonder she went on to study mechanical engineering. But the tie to her interest in fluid mechanics? Mendelson notes her many years as a competitive swimmer.â€ - hmc.edu

title: Walking Couch
text:
Welcome to our final project for Mechanical Design, a course at Harvey Mudd College focused on mechanical principles, analysis techniques, group design workflows, and product development.
This project focuses on the physical design, analysis, and implementation of an electromechanical Jansen linkage system capable of carrying a couch and passenger, allowing for stylish transport around Harvey Muddâ€™s campus. Further information about technical specifics and design decisions can be found in the tabs above.
